page.title: 08Religion in Ythanwells
page.content: All the indigenous population belongs to the Church of Scotland, but few are regular church goers. The dwindling population and poor attendances made it necessary to amalgamate with Auch- aber and services were reduced to once monthly at Ythanwells church,until it was decided 3 years ago to join the Parishes of Ythanwells, Auchaber, Forgue and Inverkeithney and to sell the local church.It was bought by a farmer and is now used as agricultural store.The Church bell was bought by the community with funds raised at functions, and is now installed in the cemetery.The parish minister comes to school fortnightly for religious in- struction, in which all pupils take part, although the children of in- comers do not belong to the C.of Scot. They also learn hymns, prayers and Bible stories.Some go to Sundayschool.
